episodes.synopsis: Jen fakes her way into a job at Reynholm Industries with some phony techno-jargon and a nice-looking resume.
episodes.title: Yesterday's Jam

episodes.synopsis: Denholm forces everyone at Reynholm Industries to take a stress test, then threatens to ax anyone who's still experiencing stress by day's end.
episodes.title: Calamity Jen

episodes.synopsis: Jen's flirtation with a company security guard gets a little out of hand when he mistakes her pretend knowledge for the real thing.
episodes.title: Fifty-Fifty

episodes.synopsis: When Roy gets stuck beneath an employee's desk, it's up to Moss to extricate his mate.
episodes.title: The Red Door

episodes.synopsis: After a disastrous date with the loutish Bill Crouse, Jen engages Moss's help in avoiding the icky man.
episodes.title: The Haunting of Bill Crouse

episodes.synopsis: Jen's "Aunt Irma" comes for her monthly visit, and suddenly Moss and Roy seem to be on Jen's cycle.
episodes.title: Aunt Irma Visits

episodes.synopsis: When the dashing Philip asks Jen to the theater, she accepts -- but so do Moss and Roy, turning what could've been a date into a work outing.
episodes.title: The Work Outing

episodes.synopsis: When Moss finds a website that takes people's personal details and calculates when they will die, he decides to try it out on Roy.
episodes.title: Return of the Golden Child

episodes.synopsis: Embarking on a weekend watching movies at Roy's flat, Moss realizes that his life is stagnating.
episodes.title: Moss and the German

episodes.synopsis: Jen has found love and is hosting a dinner party with her new bloke Peter and six of their single friends.
episodes.title: The Dinner Party

episodes.synopsis: When a bad bra causes Jen to lose concentration in a board meeting, Moss invents a bra that will never, ever go bad.
episodes.title: Smoke and Mirrors

episodes.synopsis: Douglas hires Jen as his new PA, giving Moss and Roy free reign in the office. How will they cope without her?
episodes.title: Men Without Women

episodes.synopsis: While boss Douglas does his best to run Reynholm Industries into the ground, Jen has to deal with a builder from hell, Roy loses 20 quid, and Moss learns how to stand up to ruffians.
episodes.title: From Hell

episodes.synopsis: A new football website allows Roy and Moss to pass as "proper" men for a momentous couple of days.
episodes.title: Are We Not Men?

episodes.synopsis: Jen, Roy and Moss find their lives moving in different directions after a disappointing settlement to a sexual harassment suit.
episodes.title: Tramps Like Us

episodes.synopsis: As Employee of the Month, Jen asserts herself as manager and makes powerful enemies in Moss and Roy.
episodes.title: The Speech

episodes.synopsis: Jen introduces Roy and Moss to a new social website and then finds out why some friendships are best left in the past.
episodes.title: Friendface

episodes.synopsis: Reynholm Industries is proud to announce their first sexy, nude calendar. Enough said, probably.
episodes.title: Calendar Geeks

episodes.synopsis: Jen wants to stretch herself in the workplace and applies for the post of Entertainment Manager.
episodes.title: Jen the Fredo

episodes.synopsis: Moss becomes a celebrity by beating all the records on a popular puzzle show, and Roy is mistaken for a window cleaner.
episodes.title: The Final Countdown

episodes.synopsis: Douglas becomes a Spaceologist, Roy's life is changed by a bad back, and Jen gets involved with a rock band.
episodes.title: Something Happened

episodes.synopsis: Roy gets obsessed with his latest girlfriend's sad family history, and Jen tells an absolute whopper to get some attention.
episodes.title: Italian for Beginners

episodes.synopsis: Roy and Moss become juvenile delinquents for the day and have an uncomfortable experience at a shopping center.
episodes.title: Bad Boys

episodes.synopsis: Douglas finds that marriage agrees with him ... for all of two weeks. He soon finds himself in court -- defending himself.
episodes.title: Reynholm vs Reynholm

video.title: The IT Crowd
video.synopsis: Aided by a tech-illiterate manager, a pair of basement-dwelling dweebs makes the most of life in IT at a corporation run by a cloddish new owner.
